net.jodah.concurrentunit

Class Waiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.concurrentunit.Waiter

  • public class Waiter
extends Object
    Waits on a test, carrying out assertions, until being resumed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Waiter()
      Creates a new Waiter.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Asserts that the object is not null.
      void assertNull(Object object)
      Asserts that the object is null.
      void assertTrue(boolean condition)
      Asserts that the condition is true.
      void await()
      Waits until resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.
      void await(long delay)
      Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.
      void await(long delay, int expectedResumes)
      Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called expectedResumes times, or the test is failed.
      void await(long delay, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.

      Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called expectedResumes times, or the test is failed.

      Instructs the waiter to expect the resumeNumber resumes to occur.

      Fails the current test.
      void fail(String reason)
      Fails the current test for the given reason.
      void fail(Throwable reason)
      Fails the current test with the given reason, sets the number of expected resumes to 0, and throws the reason in the current thread and the main test thread.
      int getExpectedResumes()
      Gets the remaining number of expected resumes that must occur before any waiting/sleeping threads are unblocked.
      void resume()
      Resumes the waiter when the expected number of resume() calls have occurred.
      void resume(Thread thread)
      Resumes the waiter if thread is not the mainThread or the expected number of resumes have occurred.

        public void assertEquals(Object expected,
                Object actual)

      • assertFalse

        public void assertFalse(boolean condition)
        Asserts that the condition is false.

      • assertNotNull

        public void assertNotNull(Object object)
        Asserts that the object is not null.

      • assertNull

        public void assertNull(Object object)
        Asserts that the object is null.

      • assertTrue

        public void assertTrue(boolean condition)
        Asserts that the condition is true.

      • await

        public void await()
           throws Throwable
        Waits until resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - if any assertion fails

      • await

        public void await(long delay)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay to wait in milliseconds
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - if any assertion fails

      • await

        public void await(long delay,
         TimeUnit timeUnit)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called the expected number of times, or the test is failed.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay to wait for
        timeUnit - TimeUnit to delay for
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - if any assertion fails

      • await

        public void await(long delay,
         int expectedResumes)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called expectedResumes times, or the test is failed.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay to wait for in milliseconds
        expectedResumes - Number of times resume() is expected to be called before the awaiting thread is resumed
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - if any assertion fails

      • await

        public void await(long delay,
         TimeUnit timeUnit,
         int expectedResumes)
           throws Throwable
        Waits until the delay has elapsed, resume() is called expectedResumes times, or the test is failed.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay to wait for
        timeUnit - TimeUnit to delay for
        expectedResumes - Number of times resume() is expected to be called before the awaiting thread is resumed
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called from outside the main test thread
        TimeoutException - if the operation times out while waiting for a result
        Throwable - if any assertion fails

      • expectResume

        public void expectResume()
        Instructs the waiter to expect resume() to be called.

      • expectResumes

        public void expectResumes(int resumeNumber)
        Instructs the waiter to expect the resumeNumber resumes to occur.

      • fail

        public void fail()
        Fails the current test.

      • fail

        public void fail(String reason)
        Fails the current test for the given reason.

      • fail

        public void fail(Throwable reason)
        Fails the current test with the given reason, sets the number of expected resumes to 0, and throws the reason in the current thread and the main test thread.

      • getExpectedResumes

        public int getExpectedResumes()
        Gets the remaining number of expected resumes that must occur before any waiting/sleeping threads are unblocked.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the waiter when the expected number of resume() calls have occurred.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the waiter is not expecting resume to be called

      • resume

        public void resume(Thread thread)
        Resumes the waiter if thread is not the mainThread or the expected number of resumes have occurred.

        Note: This method is likely not very useful to call directly since a concurrent run of a test case resulting in the need to resume from a separate thread would yield no correlation between the initiating thread and the thread where the resume call takes place.

        Parameters:
        thread - Thread to resume
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the waiter is not expecting resume to be called
